Class StringFunctions

extends java.lang.Object
    Supplies functions for Strings.

    • Method Detail

      • toOnlyFirstCharCapital

        public static java.lang.String toOnlyFirstCharCapital(java.lang.String input)
        Changes the case of the first character in a String to be upper case and all other characters in the String to be lower case. Letters outside of a to z and A to Z remain unchanged..
        Parameters:
        input - the String to convert
        Returns:
        the newly cased String.

      • isOnlyFirstCharCapital

        public static boolean isOnlyFirstCharCapital(java.lang.String input)
        Checks whether a String has no upper case letters except for the very first.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check.
        Returns:
        true if the first character is upper case or not a letter and every other character is lower case or not a letter. Else false.

        public static boolean containsLetter(java.lang.String input)
        Checks whether a String contains at least one letter from a to z or A to Z.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check
        Returns:
        true if at least one letter was found. Else false.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if no other Character than smaller case a to z is found

        Parameters:
        input - the String to check
        Returns:
        true if no other Character than upper case a to z is found

        Returns:

      • isNormalized

        public static boolean isNormalized(java.lang.String input)
        Checks whether a String only contains ['a'-'z'] and '_'.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check.
        Returns:
        true if only allowed Characters (ASCII 0x61 to 0x7A and 0x5F) appear in the String.

        public static boolean containsOnly(java.lang.String string,
                                   char match)
        Checks whether a String contains nothing else than an arbitrary amount of the specified character.
        Parameters:
        string - the String to check
        match - the character to match against
        Returns:
        true if only the specified character is included. Else false. Also returns false when string is null.

        Parameters:

      • containsSpecialCharacters

        public static boolean containsSpecialCharacters(java.lang.String input)
        Checks whether there is at least one special character somewhere in the specified String. A special character is every non-English-standard-letter (A-Z, a-z) or digit (0-9).
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check
        Returns:
        true if a special character was found. Else false.

        Returns:

      • startsWithAny

        public static boolean startsWithAny(java.lang.String string,
                                    StringList matchList)
        Checks whether a String "string" starts with any substring in a specified StringList "matchList".
        Parameters:
        string - the String to check.
        matchList - the list of possible Strings string could start with.
        Returns:
        true if string starts with any String in matchList. Else false.

      • indexOfFirstDigit

        public static int indexOfFirstDigit(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the index of the first digit (0-9) in the input String. Returns -1 if the String does not contain a digit.
        Parameters:
        input - any String.
        Returns:
        the index of the first digit in 'input' or -1 if there is none.
